activities.loc: Monroe County Justice Center - Branch II

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.addlTxt: Notice of Hearing- Return to Sender Not Deliverable As Addressed Unable to Forward
Initial appearance on November 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Dorinda Ann Meno appeared by phone.  Attorney Croninger appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Notice of right to an attorney was given. Defendant responds that she is trying to contact public defenders office. Court will adjourn.
Initial appearance scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
No contact with Wal-Mart Stores in Monroe County.

Defendant Dorinda Ann Meno appeared by phone.  Attorney Betthauser appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Court orders $250 signature bond with conditions to be signed by 9/2/22. Rights to an Attorney were given.
Initial appearance scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Initial appearance on October 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.
